scenes.location: BEL AIR BAY CLUB PACIFIC PALISADES, CA
characters: BULLETS IMPACT ALL ALL OVER CAR
FLOORS IT OUT OF THERE IN REVERSE
VICK DELICATELY LAYING CASH INSIDE HIS DUFFEL BAG
THE GOLDEN PONY ALL MALE REVUE."
THE TOTALLED CADILLAC ROCKETING DOWN I-15
VICK JUMPING UP FROM A WAR TABLE
CHASTITY AND THE GUYS RACE THROUGH THE STRIP CLUB
CHASTITY THROWING CRAPS AT A CRAPS TABLE
ALAN, STU, VICK AND CHASTITY SITTING AT A PAI GOW TABLE
STEVE AND THE GUYS SCHLEPPING ALL OF THE WEDDING CRAP
ALAN THROWING DOWN BLACKJACK AT A BLACKJACK TABLE
ALAN SITTING ON THE BANQUETTE, LOOKING AWESTRUCK
STANDING IN THE BACK OF THE RECEPTION
THE GUYS ROLLING DOWN THE STRIP
STU TACKLES JIMMY TO THE GROUND FIRST
STU YELLING "BINGO" AT A BINGO TABLE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a beautiful spring morning in the Palisades. High at the cliffs, looking out over the Pacific Ocean, sits the exclusive BEL AIR BAY CLUB. Workers bustle about the lawn setting up a high-end wedding. A STRING QUARTET warms up. A team of FLORISTS arrange centerpieces. CATERERS set the white linen tables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple, classic wedding dress hangs on a closet door in this sun-drenched bridal suite. Sitting at the makeup tab surrounded by her bridesmaids, is the beautiful bride, TR TURNER, 20's. She's busy doing her makeup. Just then, Tracy's rich, stern FATHER, 50's, blows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way he spits out "Doug" tells us all we need to know about how Mr. Turner feels about his future son-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm sure he's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Tracy's CELLPHONE rings. She quickly answers i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heat-waves rise off the Mojave. Standing at a lone, dust- covered payphone in the middle of the desert is

dialogues.speaker: VICK LENNON
dialogues.text: He's in his late 20's, tall, rugged -- and currently a me His shirt is ripped open, his aviator sunglasses are bent his lip is bloodied, and he clearly hasn't slept in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, it's Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parked on the dirt road behind Vick is his near-totalled Cadillac Deville convertible; it's scratched, dented, fil - and missing its passenger side door. Slouched inside are TWO OTHER GUYS, also looking like hel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her jaw dropping) What?! But we're getting married in like four hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick squints at the rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's not gonna happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The top down, The Who's "Baba O'Riley" blasting from the stereo, Vick's pristine Cadillac convertible rockets down Highway 10 towards Nevada. At the wheel is Vick, looking as sharp as his Caddy in a open shirt and mint condition aviators. Sitting shotgun is the groom, DOUG BILLINGS, late 20's, handsome, barefoot, crunchy -- an all around great guy. Behind Vick sits ALAN MERVISH, late 20's, an anal tax attorney from Connecticut, his Izod shirt tucked into his khakis. He's currently applying sun screen to his forehea Next to Alan is STU PRYCE, late 20's, former high school linebacker and lovably dimwitted father of two. He drums back of the frontseat to the music, totally pumped, like is his first time out of the house in years. Because it i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude this is already the best weekend ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, relax, we're still on the 10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, did I show you pictures of my kids?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dude, show `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu fishes pictures out of his wallet and eagerly shows t to Doug in the front seat. Doug is clearly the core of th group, the glue that holds these childhood friends togeth

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haylee is two, and Kaitlin is already four! Can you believe it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling at photos) How cute... Good for you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug shows the photos to Vick; he nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one on the left is gonna be a hottie. The other one, not so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu protectively snatches the photos back, muttering:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, dude, those are my children--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: sunscreen) Hey, am I rubbed in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu glances over and sees un-rubbed-in sunscreen all over Alan's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey so Alan, are you and Becky still together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But before Alan can answer--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course they are, Doug. Jesus, Alan's been dating Becky for 14 years. When they first met, Alan had braces and soccer hair, and Becky had a functioning hymen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Asking Alan if he's still with Becky is like asking the sun if it still rises in the east.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys try not to laugh; Alan scowls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She still pressuring you to get married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh, we've moved past the pressure stage...it's more like aggravated assault stage now? Like at the last wedding we went to, she threw a camera at my head, called me a closet fag, then ran out crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys wince, oooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we talked, and everything's cool now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could wear a helmet to Doug's wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great idea, Stu. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) So Vick, how's business going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, great. Yeah, I'm working on bringing the next big dessert craze to Los Angeles. It's gonna be huge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bavarian custard. We ran the numbers, and it's gonna be bigger than fro yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug and Stu nod, impressed; only Alan looks skeptical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't custard like a trillion calories--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our plan is to open three stores in the Valley and then franchise it. Shares are selling fast, but I can probably squeeze you guys in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, count me in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too, man! I love pudding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan just shakes his head, unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this gonna do better than the hip-hop label you started, Vick? Or the topless sushi bar? Or the mobile tattoo parlor--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tattoo-To-You was an idea ahead of it's time, Alan! And don't come crying to me when there's a Custard Cabana on every street corner in America and you didn't buy in--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) All right, all right, save it for the party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and Alan quiet. Stu is still drumming the seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude! I can't believe I get to party all night, and then, tomorrow ...I get to sleep in! It's almost too much! And FYI, if anyone gets really drunk and craps themself, just let me know, I can have you cleaned up and partying again in under three minutes. No joke. I am a master of stool removal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They rocket off into the desert, LAUGHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last rays of sun fade, the Cadillac crests the fin hill to reveal LAS VEGAS in all its illuminated splendor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy rolls down the famed Strip. We are again remind of the absurd scale of Las Vegas. The 5,000 room hotels, eight lane roads, the 60 foot billboards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy rolls up to the Mandalay Bay. The guys hop out, exhilarated. Vick throws the key to the VALET...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys enter the glittering casino four men-wide, all smiling, all exuding vibe. Passing WOMEN sneak glances. V slides a drink off a nearby waitress's tray as they make

dialogues.speaker: THE FRONT DESK
dialogues.text: A perfectly pressed LEBANESE MAN waits behind the front d Vick strides up, smiling, sunglasses still on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Mandalay Bay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checking in. Lennon comma Victor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The man types into his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we have you down for a one night stay in an economy suite--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick glances at the man's nametag; it reads "ATASHIR."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold it right there, Atashir. This is my best friend from childhood, Douglas Billings. In two days, he is to marry a woman of great beauty and strong teeth, do you understand? A woman of gigantic bosoms who will give him many, many sons...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir looks confused. Alan looks embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My two other childhood friends have travelled great distances, across many deserts, to be here. This isn't a night in a hotel for us, Atashir: this is a family reunion. Perhaps you too have family situated great distances away, in a foreign country with much sand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir looks like, sort of...? Vick reaches over the cou and touches his arm, simpatico.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I have but one question for you, friend: if they came to town, would you put them in an economy suite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then. I think one of us needs to get back on his little computer and find us a suitable room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir frowns...but types away at his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the deluxe rooms are taken. The Dean Martin suite is available, but I'd have to ask my--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dean-o will be fine. Send up a case of Cristal, two bottles of Patron, four ahi sandwiches, and a crate of skinless mangos...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick turns to the guys:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys want anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stammer, too stunned to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have Jean-Marie cook up a dozen of those duck skewers I like so well. He knows the ones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how would you like to pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: American Express.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir looks up to accept the card. After a beat, Vick t to Alan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, give him your AmEx.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, we'll hit you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan stammers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, come on, I paid for gas. Stop being such a Jew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan stammers some more -- then angrily pulls out his car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys enter the room, jostling; Stu has Doug in a headlock. Then they freeze: the Dean Martin Suite is mass complete with lounge area, two flat screen TVs, full bar multiple bedrooms. The guys just gape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bigger than my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick blows past them, totally unfazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get dressed, ladies. We're wheels up in ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Doug race off to find their bedrooms, leaving Ala standing alone, just staring at the decadent suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so not getting paid back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick enters the bedroom, drops his bag, and starts changi his shirt -- when his cell phone RINGS. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick listens -- then grows a bit panicked:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in Vegas?! You're kidding me! (WINCING) All right, I'll get it. All right. All right--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Stu walks past, Vick turns away and covers the phone trying to keep the call confidential:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said all right, dude! How many more times you want me to say all right?! (BEAT) All right. All right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick hangs up, looking uncharacteristically stressed...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug brushes his teeth while, at the next sink over, Alan selects a facial wash from his highly organized toiletrie kit and begins washing his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you ready for Sunday?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I thought I'd be nervous, but I'm actually just really psyched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan nods, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's dad still hate you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any closer to figuring out why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enh, I think he wanted more for his girl. I mean, I'm a teacher who makes 45 grand a year, and he's a titan of industry who makes 45 grand a day, you know? I sort of get it... (beat, brushing teeth) Also, I'm banging his daughter. I'm not sure you ever get past that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan smiles, yeah, there's that. Doug spits out his paste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got floss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan gestures towards his toiletries kit. Doug picks it u starts looking for the floss. Then Alan remembers somethi but it's too late. Doug has found the RING BOX inside Ala kit, and opened it to reveal a HUGE DIAMOND ENGAGEMENT RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy Christ!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan quickly reaches for the ring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh yeah, I wasn't going to tell anyone about that--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Stu wanders in, wearing only his COLORADO STAT BOXER SHORTS. His gut is sizable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone got any nipple lube--? (seeing ring) Jesus would you look at the size of that thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu grabs the ring from Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Alan's. For Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, who made this thing? Diddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching for ring) Actually, I-I was trying to keep it a secret, so--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Vick blows in, singing, effeminate:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy Party in the bathrooooom--! (sees ring, snags it) Miner's cut, 2.6 Carats, slight pink tint, street value: 26, 27K.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick studies it in the light. Alan just rubs his temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, it's for Becky! Alan's finally going to propose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well gosh-golly, Alan Mervish, good for you! Where'd you get the ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's a family heirloom. My grandmother smuggled it through the Holocaust, actually. I was going to propose to Beck this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug throws his arm around Alan, happy for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well: now we have two things to celebrate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys, dressed to the nines, open the steel rooftop do and file out onto the flat tar roof of the Mandalay Bay; is carrying a bottle of Patron and four hotel glasses. Bringing up the rear, Alan slides a wood block between th door and the frame so they aren't locked up here. The guys step out onto the dark, windy roof and take in t stunning panorama...the Strip...the mountains...the count stars... It's breathtaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thish is so great! I love you guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out, Stu's already wasted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick starts refilling everyone's glasses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've only had two shots, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what happened, Stuey?! You used to be able to drink us all under the table!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I'm a dad! I don't have time to get plastered anymore! It blows! (QUICKLY) Am I a bad dad for saying that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because my dad was a bad dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (patting his shoulder) That's true, Stuey, but you're different. We've talked about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu just stares at the guys, glassy-eyed. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I showed you guys pictures of my kids yet--? ALAN & DOUG & VICK YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug laughs and raises his glass for a toast, heartfelt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little toast: to Tracy, the coolest, kindest, most beautiful woman I've ever met. I can't believe she let me come this weekend -- much less agreed to spend the rest of her life with me. I think both will prove to be massive errors of judgement on her part.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys chuckle, hear-hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And to being here, with my best friends in the world. There's nowhere else I'd rather be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys raise their glasses, touched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That said, let's not get too stupid tonight, okay? I'm getting married in 36 hours. ALAN & STU & VICK No, no. / We'll be good. / Totally, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug lowers his glass, laughing, completely unconvinced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm serious, dudes! Nothing above the neck -- no piercings, no weird haircuts, no facial tattoos. I gotta look decent on Sunday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what do you take us for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick: you shaved Alan's eyebrows off the night before graduation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah! That was hilarious! And remember when I blacked out at Homecoming and you wrote on my face with permanent marker?! That was awesome! What'd you write again? ALAN & DOUG & VICK "Respect me!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all laugh. Stu throws his arm around Doug, nostalgic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahh, good times, man. Good times...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be good tonight, Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously, man, we're your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we've totally grown up since then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug looks at them, highly dubious, then hoists his glass

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then...to a night we'll never forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They CLINK glasses, shoot their shots, and

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: Shafts of white desert sunlight pour into

dialogues.speaker: THE DEAN MARTIN SUITE
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA follows a LIVE CHICKEN as it walks through the totalled suite. Furniture is broken, the minibar ransacked, and the floor covered with remnants of the night before: empty beer can platefuls of room service food, a cowboy hat, the Gideon Bible, half-eaten skinless mangos, a bra, a battle axe, e SNORING on the couch, wearing only his jeans and one shoe the word ASSHOLE written in Sharpie across his chest, is

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: The chicken struts across the top of the couch, until it reaches a plastic coin cup from Bellagio blocking its pat Beat. Then the chicken pecks it off...onto Stu. The cup hits Stu in the face, and stale beer splashes all over him. Stu spastically jerks awake and flips off the couch, onto a pile of newspapers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OWW! Get off! Get off! Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confused, Stu clambers off the pile of newspapers -- to f Vick sleeping underneath, on the floor, fully dressed. Vi pulls himself onto the couch, clearly in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn, dude, why are you retarded?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both men are ragingly hungover. A long beat as both of them rub their faces, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, Stuey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you have a mullet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu does, in fact, have a mullet haircut. But he's too hungover to understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, business on top, party down the back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu still looks confused. This is excruciating for Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your hair, dude. You have a mullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu touches his hair. Then he stumbles into the bathroom. After a beat, we hear his voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude...I have a mullet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then we hear ALAN'S VOICE in the bathroom, groggy:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me ten more minutes, Beck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, did you sleep in the tub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat, then Stu pokes his head out of the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out: Alan slept in the tub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him up. I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu disappears back into the bathroom. We hear the SHOWER turn on. Beat. Then we hear Alan slowly awaken:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wet. Water. Jesus, what's--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a THUD as Alan falls out of tub. Beat. Then Stu and a very confused, very hungover, very wet Ala stumble out of the bathroom. Alan appears to be wearing his polo shirt from the night before. Only, as we PULL BACK, we see that his shirt is c off at his chest -- he's naked from there down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, dude, put away your sack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks down at his hairy nakedness, totally bewildere

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and it might be time for some manscaping, bro. Your bush looks like Yanni.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks back up again, squinting, hungover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did we do last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys, now dressed, stagger out of their suite moments later. Stu walks incredibly bow-legged, like an aging cow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, why is my ass killing me...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking like crap, the guys silently descend in the eleva BING! The elevator opens to expose a NICE-LOOKING COUPLE waiting to get on. They see the guys and immediately step away from the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll...we'll get the next one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors close. The guys continue to descend. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We might not smell very good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys shake their heads, yeah, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys slouch in a booth, shoveling masses of buffet fo into their mouths, washing it down with huge mugs of coff

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This might be the worst hangover anyone has ever had, ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't taste anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please stop talking. If I don't focus on eating I'm going to throw up all over myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys nod, right. They keep eating. After a long while

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey... Are we missing something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all slowly look around. Then Stu points at Alan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes: I left my hat in the room -- thank you, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue eating. Alan looks up again, still troubled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. That's not it... There's something else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick nods at Stu as he stuffs food in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna finish that cruller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shakes his head, no. Vick takes it, packs it into his already stuffed mouth. Then Alan realizes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug. Guys, where's Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look around. Hunh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. He's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably left him in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick pulls out his cell phone, starts dialing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then a phone RINGS in Stu's pocket. He answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning, this is Stu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, meatdick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alan, concerned) It's Vick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Stu realizes. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Doug's phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick nods, ya. He's already dialing another number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You calling the room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick nods, uh-huh. He lets it ring, rubbing his temples. he hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick goes back to eating. Alan frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummm...shouldn't we look for him? Check-out is in like ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and we told Tracy we'd have Doug back to LA by five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick just looks at both of them, his mouth full of food:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm eabing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an asshole. Stu, check the pool and the casino, I'll check the room and the gym. Maybe he's working out or something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu nods, and they slowly slide out of the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Vick, if you could keep a close eye on the buffet, that'd be really helpful. Thanks, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Stu saunter off. Vick yells after them, mouth fu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HE'S FIME! YOU'RE OBERWEACTING!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick scowls, and angrily takes Alan's last cruller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan weaves through the totalled suite, half-awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug...? Doug...? Wake up, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan enters the bedroom where Doug slept, and stops. It t him a second to realize what's wrong:

dialogues.speaker: THE BED IS MISSING
dialogues.text: There are four indentations on the carpet where it once l Alan scratches his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's weird...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, walking bow-legged, squinting painfully in the brigh sun, tries to inspect everyone lying around the huge pool Doug? Doug? Several HOT WOMEN in bikinis sit up, disguste

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. It's cool, I'm a dad. It's totally cool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan stumbles through the gym, looking for Doug. The plac packed with fit people, working out. Alan mumbles to hims

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate you all...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu wanders through the casino, calling out, incredibly l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG! DOUG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two GAY MEN in identical tank tops pass by, holding hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys. DOUG! DOUG--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Stu registers what just happened. He stops and turns around -- enh? -- but the gay men are gone. Before he can comment, however, he sees Vick and Alan talking to Atashir at

dialogues.speaker: THE RECEPTION DESK
dialogues.text: He slowly bow-legs himself over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I assume you didn't either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shakes his head, no. Then Atashir hangs up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no Doug Billings at any of the area hospitals, morgues, or police stations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys frown, starting to grow worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he went for a jog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude. It's 120 degrees outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or shopping?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys just look at him like: you're an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. So we've officially lost Doug. His wedding is in what, 22 hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, it's Doug, he's probably crashed out on someone's couch right now. All we have to do is retrace our steps from last night, and we'll find him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so last night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys wince, trying to remember. It's painful to think

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we started on the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, that was like, 6ish...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then...I think...we had steaks at the Palm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Then...we played craps at the Hard Rock...maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu throws up his arms, already giving up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, honestly? I don't even remember going to dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I vaguely recall...doing body shots ....at some point? Is that...maybe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm pretty much blank after The Hard Rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we went to the Flamingo after that...? And then, I just remember a lot of blue light...and the overpowering smell of baby oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that was what, 10ish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give or take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was Doug still with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick rubs his temples, trying to fight through the hangov

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. Doug was with us. I tackled him...for some reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys nod, okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. So we only have a 13 hour window where we could've lost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guys frown. Shit. Stu puts his hands into his pocket thinking... Then he feels something. A matchbook. He pulls it out. It's from The Flamingo Nightclub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Look, we were at the Flamingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat of silence... Then the guys hurry to an empty BLACKJACK TABLE and start emptying their pockets of the detritus from the night bef They find matchbooks, receipts, room keys, a valet ticket

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ATM receipt from the Rio at 10:37-- (reading it) For 600 dollars?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The valet ticket says we returned here at 4:57AM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We drove last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys wince, jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's a receipt from Sbarro. The meal was comped for some reason--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we have a matchbook from The Golden Pony All Male Revue?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exchange a look, alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone could've given that to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing, nervous) Yeah, totally! There's no way we went there! We're not gay! Hahaha!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They frown, then stare at all the clues lined up on the blackjack table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should call Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if Doug called her? She might know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shifts uncomfortably, tenderly adjusting his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm with Alan on this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you're with Alan, you're both gutless cowards. But we're not calling Tracy. You never call the bride from the bachelor party. Ever. If my balls were on fire and Tracy was sitting next door with a tall glass of water, I still wouldn't call her. It's a rule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But shouldn't we at least tell her we're gonna be getting home late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has a watch, she'll figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm beginning to see why you're always single.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I think I'm beginning to see why you're always a douche--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clutching his ass) Guys, wait. I need your help -- oh my God -- like right now. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and Alan unhappily stand in the lavish, gold-enscons men's room, watching Stu painfully undo his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we're doing this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to look up my butt, just at it. Something is terribly, terribly wrong...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu's jeans fall to the ground -- and everyone freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's wearing a snug FLUORESCENT PINK G-STRING with "I ROGER" written vertically down the front. In glitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sweet mother of mercy...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I-I don't know?! What do you think it means?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do I think it means? Well, Stuart, your ass is all torn up and you're wearing thong underwear declaring your love for another dude -- I don't think we need the CSI team for this one! You got reamed last night, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu covers his mouth, horrified!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure there's a perfectly logical explanation for this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?! What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan tries to think of one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, maybe there isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm sure Roger is a very nice, considerate young man--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, guys: what if I'm gay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Stu, you're nowhere near cool enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gasping, realizing) I do watch Dancing With The Stars with the kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god, that doesn't mean you're gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sort of...it does?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu grows increasingly frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And once, I caught myself gazing at a topless photo of David Beckham!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, he's a great-looking dude--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then I had those weird feelings for Vick that time in middle school, remember?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops. Vick most of all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that weekend we were all camping -- I told you this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no you didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'd remember, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think we'd all remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I had weird feelings for you that weekend. Like really hot, really gay feelings. But then they went away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick is just looking at him, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- I was there that weekend. Did you have gay feelings for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! I was a good-looking kid!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, you're so not his type!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a FATHER and his YOUNG SON enter the men's roo and see Stu standing there, pants down, in his G string..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Stu, one homosexual experience doesn't mean you're permanently gay, okay? A lot of guys test the waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the FATHER and SON wheel right back around and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, we're scaring the children. Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys head for the door. Stu quickly pulls up his pant

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- so have either of you tested the waters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! We're not gay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu looks highly confused as he follows them out onto

dialogues.speaker: THE CASINO FLOOR
dialogues.text: The guys power through the crowded casino, towards the ex Stu tries to keep up, genuinely concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How am I going to tell my wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quickly, and from a great distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan's hand accidentally hits a brass railing and CLINKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what kind of father am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan's hand CLINKS against the railing again, and this ti it registers. Alan looks down -- and stops cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (really scared) You think Erin will try to take the kids--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh...my...God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning, annoyed) What now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan holds up the source of his CLINKING: on his ring fin is a huge, tacky, silver WEDDING RING with a unicorn on i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (not getting it) Cool ring. Also, my Dad is gonna have a field day with this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick, however, recognizes the implications of the ring, a starts back towards Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God... Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the big--? (finally realizing) Oh! OH! OH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan steadies himself against a SLOT MACHINE, and shakily takes off the massive unicorn ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's not a wedding ring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading inscription) "To My Noble Husband, Alan."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys eyes bulge, oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is worse than my underwear!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick takes the ring and reads the rest of the inscription

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Now & Forever Wedding Chapel."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They guys exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least it's a lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Then Alan turns and THROWS UP all over the slot machine. Nearby OCTOGENARIAN SLOT PLAYERS look over, disgusted -- but continue playing their nickels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three guys exit the hotel looking like crap. Vick han his ticket to the valet. Alan chews mint gum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we go to the wedding chapel, we find out what we did with Doug, we recover him, and we're back in LA before sundown. Easy as Stu's ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one laughs. Tense SILENCE as they wait for the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check it out, some idiot threw his bed out the window last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu points over at a huge stone GRIFFIN in front of the h with an ENTIRE BED impaled upon its ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was us, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, there's no bed in Doug's room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FROWNING) Oh. Well, I'm sure we had a good reason for doing it. (BEAT) You think they'll charge us for--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Stu, I really do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, relax. Everything's gonna be cool...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the Valet drives up in

dialogues.speaker: VICK'S DESTROYED CADILLAC
dialogues.text: The exterior is scratched and filthy, like it's been off- roading. The hubcaps are gone, as is the front passenger door. A wisp of STEAM trails up from under the hood. The guys just stand there, agape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, Vick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not emotionally prepared to talk about it just yet, Stuart, but thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick dons his sunglasses and heads for his destroyed car.

dialogues.speaker: THE GUYS ROLLING DOWN THE STRIP
dialogues.text: in their ridiculous car. Cars full of FAMILIES, cute GIRL even NUNS, point and stare. Our guys just face forward, e quietly suffering in their own personal Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seriously: what am I gonna tell Becky? For 14 years she's been begging me to get married...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now you did. Just not to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan glowers at the city going by... Then he sits up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, is that homeless guy wearing Doug's shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys turn to see a HOMELESS GUY weaving down the side in Doug's DISTINCTIVE ORANGE SHIRT from the night before. Once they pass, the guys exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naaah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that was a different shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan doesn't look so sure. They drive in silence. Then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Left turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, sitting shotgun, braces against the empty doorframe as not to fall out of the car as they turn left... EXT. NOW & FOREVER WEDDING CHAPEL -- DAY Sitting in an East Vegas strip mall, sandwiched between a laundromat and a pawn shop, is the pink Now & Forever Chapel. The Cadillac parks in the lot out front. INT. NOW & FOREVER WEDDING CHAPEL -- DAY Everything in the small, tacky wedding chapel is white plastic. White plastic plants, white plastic cross, white plastic chairs. The guys enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if they don't remember us--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAYYYYY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys turn to find the hirsute owner of the chapel, ST GIANOPOLUS, 40's, in a tight white suit, his arms spread wide. Steve is all Vegas, by way of Long Island.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you, you dumb bastards?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He warmly hugs the guys. They have zero memory of him, an shows as they hug back weakly, unfamiliar...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARLA, GET YOUR FAT ASS OUT HERE! ALAN AND THE BOYS ARE HERE! (to the guys) You here to pick up your wedding photos?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan starts to decline, when--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does the pope wear a funny hat?! Let's do this thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Steve CACKLES and guides them over to a table; Alan scowl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And where is Chastity today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all sit on white plastic chairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: W-Who's...Chastity?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (LAUGHING) Your wife, man--! AWW, you're just breaking my balls!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks ill. Laughing, Steve retrieves a folder and st laying out a series of WEDDING PHOTOS on the table. Vick eagerly peruses them, enjoying this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, it was such a lovely ceremony, wasn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hand to God, I've never seen two people more in love!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadly, I believe you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at the photos of Alan's wedding from the ni before. They're typical wedding shots, only the guys are wearing MEDIEVAL COSTUMES, swords, bows, tights, even arm They look incredibly happy -- and incredibly drunk. The next photo is of Alan and his BUSTY BLONDE BRIDE. She having a blast in a white medieval gown and tiara.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Chastity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan just closes his eyes, oh God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am never...ever...drinking again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, she is stacked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, please, show some class. That's Alan's wife you're talking about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alan, guilty) Sorry. She looks really nice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Alan is too busy gaping at the next photo, of him and Chastity atop a UNICORN in the chapel. (It is, of course, rented pony with a lame horn strapped to its head.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a unicorn?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, you got the entire Double Camelot Package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan just rubs his temples, oh no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A-And how much did that cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7 thousand dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan closes his eyes. Stu and Vick exchange a look, no wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you didn't want to get it, either, but Vick insisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Then Alan pounces across the table at Vick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna kill you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (fending him off) You can't put a pricetag on love, Alan! OW! You just can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu hops up and starts pulling Alan off of Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STOP FIGHTING IMMEDIATELY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys straighten like schoolboys as Steve's wife CARLA 40's, enters. She's wearing a toga, smoking a menthol, an dollying in several large CARDBOARD BOXES. Then she grins

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahhh! I'm just busting your nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lowers the dolly and hurries over for hugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to see you, you stupid mooks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Alan force smiles, no idea who this woman is. Vic on the other hand, steps forward and hugs her tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good to be seen, Carla. It's good to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought the rest of your package.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carla begins unloading things from the cardboard boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First: Two dozen commuter mugs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She unpacks 24 COMMUTER MUGS with Alan and Chastity's pho emblazoned on them. Alan winces, oh god. Stu grabs one:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way! Awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred DVDs of the ceremony...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lays out the stacks of DVDs. Vick nods at Alan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you and Chastity to watch on your anniversary...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan just clenches his jaw, I fucking hate you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The velvet wall hanging...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls out a six foot air-brushed velvet WALL HANGING Alan and Chastity riding the unicorn together in outer sp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it looks like real velvet, Alan, so no machine wash, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the big finish:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and Stu do a DRUMROLL on the table, excited... Then Carla pulls out a FOUR FOOT BRONZE SHIELD with a bas relief of Alan and Chastity MAKING OUT on it. Alan just closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOLY CRAP!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DUDE, YOU HAVE A SHIELD!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a shield!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me too! Hey, can Stu and I get a shield?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose you have any sort of return policy, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um...if you know another couple who looks exactly like you guys, and who want two dozen commuter mugs, a wall hanging, and a shield...sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan scowls. Then his cellphone RINGS. He angrily answers without looking at the Caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We hear someone YELLING AT HIM. Alan's eyes bulge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey Becky! Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He steps away to take the call. Vick explains to Carla:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's his girlfriend of 14 years. I'm sure this'll only take a minute...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and Stu go back to looking at the wedding photos as tries to talk to his furious girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: in her Laura Ashley bedroom, angrily packing up her suitc She's beautiful and preppy in pearls and a sweater set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you tell me why all the goddamn credit cards are maxed out?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! I-I have no idea--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Vick calls over from the white plastic table, pissed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY ALAN, HOW COME I WASN'T YOUR BEST MAN, DUDE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YEAH, WHAT THE HELL, ME EITHER! WHY'D YOU PICK DOUG?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan waves at them, shut the hell up! But Becky has heard

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Your best man?!" What's going on there, Alan?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! Baby, nothing, the GUYS ARE JUST BEING DICKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY ALAN, YOU WANT ALL YOUR WALLET- SIZED WEDDING PHOTOS, OR CAN I BOGART A FEW?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan furiously flips them off, shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really don't appreciate being mocked right now, Alan, especially about wedding-related issues. You know how hard this weekend is going to be for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, baby! I know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll call the credit card company and straighten this out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I will. I promise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Okay... (beat, calming) Look, sorry I'm so tense... I'll see you soon, okay? Love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Alan is just staring at the BRONZE SHIELD of him maki out with his blonde bombshell wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan? Hello? I said I love you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, no, I love you too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky hangs up, rolling her eyes, unbelievable. STAY WITH ALAN as he closes his cellphone. Exhales.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how's Becky doing, man?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, did she ask about us?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off of Alan's hate-filled glare, we

dialogues.speaker: STEVE AND THE GUYS SCHLEPPING ALL OF THE WEDDING CRAP
dialogues.text: through the strip mall parking lot, back to their car. Al sullenly carries the GIANT BRONZE SHIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look on the bright side, Alan. Vick found a great clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns out Doug was in all the wedding photos, which means -- if the time stamp was right -- we had him in our possession until 11 pm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's another hour of last night that we can account for. Isn't that great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bitterly sarcastic) Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Steve, you don't happen to know where we were heading when we left here last night, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the Double Camelot Package comes with a five course wedding feast, so I assume you went there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great -- where was the feast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sbarro, over in the Fremont mall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paid 7 grand for Sbarro?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The beatup Caddy is packed with wedding crap. Vick is bus trying to reverse the overloaded car out of the parking s Stu's in the backseat with the huge shield, while Alan seethes up front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your negativity is like a little black cloud over our car, Alan. You've got to let go of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of what, exactly, Vick?! The fact that I married a complete stranger last night? Or that my girlfriend's about to leave me? Or that I'm broke? Which one?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're broke? I thought you were LOADED--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think it's like terminally uncool to be in a committed relationship, Vick, but I actually love Becky, okay? (SINCERE) I-I honestly don't know what I'd do without her...I really don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks off, lost, sick. Vick stops the car short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan. Honey. Have you considered, even for a second, that maybe the things we do when we're drunk are what we secretly want to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping with sarcasm) Yeah, no, you're absolutely right, Vick, I've always secretly wanted to marry a bottle blonde with big fake melon tits named Chastity!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't mad atcha, dude...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or, after 14 years, maybe you don't have the balls to leave Becky, and this is your way of getting her to leave you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to propose to her this weekend, you jackass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the more reason to freak out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan opens his mouth to respond, but nothing comes out. V nods, chew on that, and continues slowly reversing the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Alan Mervish, I do, but you've always had a major pole up your ass. Maybe last night was your inner cool person trying to get out-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I swear to God, Vick, if you say one more word to me, I will destroy you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, come on, let's not use our angry words--

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: A baseball bat SHATTERS the windshield! The guys all jump Vick slams on the brakes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look up to see two MASSIVE SAMOAN MEN in loud Hawaii shirts, KALOLO FANALUA and KIKIOLANI, 30's, standing on either side of the car. And they look pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of the car, Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Alan recoil in terror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are these guys?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, please. (to Kalolo Fanalua) I think there's been some sort of mistake, Mister...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Mr. Shut The Hell Up And Get The Hell Outta The Car, and this is my associate, Mr. Smash You In The Teeth If You Say Another Word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat, to Alan) Those so aren't their real names.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick, don't be a dick--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan? Relax. These men aren't going to hurt us. They're from Hawaii.

dialogues.speaker: SMASH
dialogues.text: Kikiolani starts viciously smashing the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're from Guam, bitch! Now get outta the car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay! Cool it with the bat! Jesus, why is everyone trying to kill my car...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick undoes his seatbelt   and reaches for his door handl Kikiolani lowers his bat   -- and Vick throws the door op right into his nuts! The   huge Samoan staggers back, OWW Vick slams his door shut   and

dialogues.speaker: FLOORS IT OUT OF THERE IN REVERSE
dialogues.text: The Caddy sideswipes a car, hops the curb, and lands on t street! They SQUEAL AWAY, the huge bronze shield flying o of the backseat as they do! It CLATTERS on the pavement..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick drives like the wind, trying to see around the huge SPIDERWEB in the windshield. Alan and Stu are freaking ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (INCREDULOUS) Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they just wanted to talk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I honestly don't know how you two are still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think we stole something from them last night?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god I am such a bad dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (producing cellphone) I'm calling the police. This is getting way out of control--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No cops!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "No cops?!" Who are you, Fitty Cent?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Vick, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! I just think we should focus on finding Doug and not get distracted by every little thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every little thing?! We were just assaulted by the Yakuza!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, those guys are from Guam. Get a grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They knew your name, Vick! Which means they probably know who Stu and I are, too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If anything ever happened to my family, Vick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Let's just go back to the hotel -- Doug is probably back from wherever he spent the night, we'll get him, we'll straighten out whatever we did to those angry Samoans, then we'll get the hell back to LA, okay? Left turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick angrily takes a harder-than-necessary left turn. Ala hangs on tight, almost flying out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys hurry into their room, stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug? Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan quickly checks the room phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No messages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's toss the place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan starts wading through the crap in the living room, w Vick and Stu head off to check the bedrooms...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu brushes aside beer bottles and room service dishes, looking for anything relevant. He spots a LEGAL CONTRACT the ground. Picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check it out, Vick! I invested 30 grand in your custard store last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick calls from the other bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smart move, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu opens the closet door -- and freezes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you wanna come in here a sec?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick enters a moment later to find Stu staring into the closet. Vick follows his gaze and sees a SEXY WOMAN snori away on the closet floor, her blonde hair obscuring her f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think she's what those Guamian dudes wanted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I think she's Alan's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu covers his mouth, oh shit! Vick produces the wallet- sized photos from Alan's wedding, compares them, and nods

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan? Wanna step in here, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second later Alan enters, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, Chastity. Chastity, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks down, sees Chastity SNORING on the closet floo her body all contorted, and freezes. Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...what am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake her up, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's your spouse, dude!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scowling, Alan slowly crouches down. Then, a little scare he nudges her. Nothing. He nudges her harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pinch her tit. It always works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan shakes her a bit harder and -- BRRAPPPP -- the girl out a massive burp and awakens, COUGHING. Alan jumps back terrified. The woman, CHASTITY, looks around, disoriented

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dang, did I sleep in the closet again...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she notices the guys staring down at her. She smiles recognizing them:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey, guys! What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She shakily climbs to her feet to expose a skimpy skirt, snug tube top, and mascara smeared all over her face. The guys have no idea what to say. She kisses Alan on the cheek, very intimate -- like, well, a husband and wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, honey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits into the living room, picking her wedgie. Beat. Alan is speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems really cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I really like her, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity gathers her belongings -- jacket, purse, G strin from around the totalled living room. The guys file in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, um, did you take Alan's name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, are you Chastity Mervish now--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me. Just...did we, or did we not, have sex last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan braces, please say no, please say no... Vick braces, please say yes, please say yes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan slumps, his life over. Vick pumps his fist, YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we waited til we were married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan GROANS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What a responsible, upstanding young Jew. They don't make `em like that anymore, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity smiles, sweet, as she straps on her 6 inch heels

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know -- he even wanted to use a rubber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan breaks into a COUGHING FIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- we didn't use a condom?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cool, I sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan leans against a wall, dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can someone...please open a window?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu turns and tries to open a window. No luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They don't open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you guys don't remember any of last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, not so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, been there before, right? (grabbing her sizable bra) Sucks, though. The wedding was really fun. I'm bummed you don't remember it, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles, a little saddened. Stu whispers to Alan:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I think your wife's mad at you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't happen to remember what time we met you last night, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, we met at the bar at like 10:00? Then we got married on my smoke break, which was like 11:00?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the All-American love story, isn't it? What happened next?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I had to go back to work. But when I got off at 5:30, I met up with you guys back here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And was Doug with us then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Interesting... Do you have any idea where we went after the wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I bet some of my work friends do. You were partying with them pretty hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work friends?

dialogues.speaker: STRIPPERS
dialogues.text: Dozens of `em, dancing, grinding, shimmying on poles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity leads the guys through Vegas's Most Notorious St Club, The Crazy Horse. It's bacchanalia writ large, compl with throbbing music, flashing strobe lights, and six sta of spinning flesh. The place is mobbed with PATRONS. Alan follows after Chastity, horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You work here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind him, Vick SLAPS FIVE with Stu, psyched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah -- and this is the pole where we first met!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stops at a pole, around which a BRUNETTE STRIPPER currently spins. Alan looks ill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always been my lucky pole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know how to tell you this, but--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HEY PLATINUM, CHECK IT OUT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds up her hand, showing off ALAN'S GRANDMOTHER'S R to the stripper currently upside-down on the pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it, girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, let's go meet my bridesmaids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hurries off, but Alan can't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Holocaust, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan just stares into space. Vick takes him by the should

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we can get your grandmother's ring back. We just gotta go about it in the right way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have besmirched my people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so hard on yourself, dude--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then Chastity runs back over with two BLONDE STRIPPE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These were my bridesmaids, Anastasia and Starr!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, boys! Good to see you again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mazel Tov--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then a SPOTLIGHT finds Chastity and Alan, and the SL PONYTAILED DJ up in the booth comes over the P.A. system:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OKAY, GUYS! LET'S GIVE A CRAZY HORSE SHOUT-OUT TO OUR HAPPY NEW COUPLE, CHASTITY AND ALANNNN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire club CHEERS! Chastity holds up her wedding rin and dances around, WOO HOO! Alan waves meekly. Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IN HONOR OF THEIR MARRIAGE, WE'RE DOING TWO-FOR-ONE LAPDANCES! TWO SONGS FOR TWENTY BUCKS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DJ puts on Nine Inch Nails' "I Want to Fuck You Like Animal" and the club gets hopping again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, he's playing our song! (giddy, to Alan) This song was playing when we met, remember?! You kept sliding twenties into my thong and saying "I will always love you. I will always love you."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenties?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was so sweet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't know how to say this, but my friends and I were very drunk last night. We would never come to a place like this--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He glances over at Vick and Stu -- but they're gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: and downing them. PULL BACK to see that they are sitting

dialogues.speaker: THE CHAMPAGNE ROOM
dialogues.text: getting lapdances from STARR and ANASTASIA. The Champagne Room is a dark, plush private suite in the back of the Cr Horse where strippers ply their craft; the room is half f Vick watches Starr lean over and make out with Anastasia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are the best bridesmaids ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (huge boobs in his face) Dude: I might not be gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Alan hurries in with Chastity; he looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-for-ones, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this! We gotta find Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting into the mindset of last night, to see if it sparks any memories. (to his stripper) Now: is this exactly how you were dancing for me last night, Starr?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods. Vick nods, pensive, scientific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, still no memories. Keep going -- and put your back into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are so goddamn selfish, Vick. You really are. Stu, let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Stu, sit and enjoy your dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu looks between them, torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude: Doug is missing! We have less than 18 hours til his wedding! We do not have time for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to save your life here, Alan Mervish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding, man! Life is one long series of emergencies, and if you don't learn to stop and have a little fun along the way, you're gonna grow into a joyless old prick like your dad. I'm sorry to bring Moshe Mervish into it, but it had to be said. Now yes, we have 18 hours to find Doug -- which means we can afford to spend ten minutes celebrating the special talents of these gifted young body-artists. So sit down, have a jager shot, and smell the goddamn roses for once in your miserable life. Chastity, honey? When you're ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity pushes Alan onto the red leather banquette and starts dancing for him. He tries to squirm away:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, look-- I am like totally against this, morally and politically. Plus Becky specifically asked me not to--

dialogues.speaker: ALAN SITTING ON THE BANQUETTE, LOOKING AWESTRUCK
dialogues.text: as Chastity works a wildly erotic lapdance on him. She cr onto his lap, she whips him with her long hair, she puts tongue in his ear. Next to him, no longer getting lapdanc Vick and Stu just sit, staring at Chastity, entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I know why he married her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if he hadn't, I would've.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue watching on in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it weird that we're sitting this close watching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More watching in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really shouldn't be here. I have daughters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then both of their heads angle the same way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that can do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can she do that without dislocating her hip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she's been touched by God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They continue staring, amazed. Just then, the door is kic open and KIKIOLANI and KALOLO FANALUA burst into the Champagne Room, peering through the darkness, looking for guys. Vick and Stu see them immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both hop up. Alan remains sitting, however, hypnotiz by Chastity. Vick grabs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan, come on, man, we gotta go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, whoa, I'm smelling the roses--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick literally yanks Alan up from the banquette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man! We got company!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, the Guamians spot the guys and lumber for them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity, honey, is there a back way out of here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking fast, Chastity grabs her clothes and darts over a darkened, unlabeled FIRE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys race after her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
