dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys sprint through the bright, crowded hallways of the Crazy Horse, weaving through strippers, cocktail waitresses, and barbacks. Behind them, the two massive Samoans try to follow, but a slowed by all the foot traffic. Strippers SCREAM as they' bowled over by the obese Islanders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spotlight holds on a CLOSED CURTAIN covering the main stage. Some sort of techno Limp Bizkit song is playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANNND ON STAGE ONE, PUT YOUR HANDS TOGETHER FOR...DOUBLE STAXXX!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the patrons turn their attention to Stage One -- then blows through the curtain, out of breath. Beat. The patro look at Stu, confused. Stu looks at them, equally so. The patrons start to BOOO, just as Vick, Chastity, and Al blow through the curtain after Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity, in six inch leucite heels, sprints down the mai runway, leaps over the patrons sitting at the end, and hi the floor running!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she just do that in heels?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really starting to like this girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all follow suit, sprinting down the runway and leaping over the patrons! Then the Guamians blow through the curtain, panting, very upset. They lumber down the stage -- and the patrons at t end of the runway clear the hell out of the way.

dialogues.speaker: CHASTITY AND THE GUYS RACE THROUGH THE STRIP CLUB
dialogues.text: Upsetting cocktails, hopping onto stages and then off aga leaping over chairs, spinning around stripper poles, and, finally, sprinting out the front door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The massive Guamians give chase, leaving a wide trail of destruction behind them, like two elephants trampling thr a forest. Just as they're blowing out of the door, howeve

dialogues.speaker: THEY'RE CLOTHESLINED BY TWO CHAIRS
dialogues.text: being swung into their chests! SMASH! They both stumble backwards, and then four roided-up STRIP CLUB SECURITY GU pounce on them, wrestling them to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to walkie talkie) Viper One, this is Rolling Thunder, we've subdued the targets, over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys hurry around the corner from the Cr Horse, laughing, exhilarated from the chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you see them trample those tiny Japanese businessmen?! I think they killed like four of them!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone laughs. Vick puts his arm around Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Alan: tell me that wasn't just a little fun...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was...a little fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick smiles -- just as a LAS VEGAS POLICE CAR hops the cu lights flashing, and cuts them off! Two mustachioed COPS out and hurry for them, pointing, intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Lennon?! Alan Mervish?! Stuart Pryce?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SCARED) Y-Yes?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're coming with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two LVPD cops, OFFICER MERRIWEATHER and OFFICER BLADE 40's, pace about this bare interrogation room, while Vick Alan and Stu sit behind the cold metal table. Vick looks tense, but in control. Stu and Alan are sweati terrified. They've clearly been here a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you last night at 3am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, how about at 2am?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ditto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Bladen SLAMS the table with his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is cute, son?! You think this is a game?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever we did, we're so sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, man, I will confess to anything you want!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu: stop talking. Alan: sit up straight. Officer Merriweather, I've told you twelve times now: we have no memory of last night. Now either charge us with a crime, or let us go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merriweather scowls and nods at Bladen, who steps over to TELEVISION and turns it on. Merriweather, meanwhile, pull out a photograph of a slick ASIAN MAN in a red suit, slid it onto the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you know about Jimmy Lang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick flinches ever-so-slightly, clearly knowing something Stu and Alan just look at the photograph, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Lang runs the infamous Shiang- Xi crime organization, and is wanted in seven states for money laundering, drug smuggling, racketeering and murder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we kill someone last night--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have no idea who this man is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TELEVISION, grainy surveillance camera footage of birthday party starts playing. In the video, JIMMY LANG s in an upscale restaurant, in front of a BIRTHDAY CAKE, as table full of hip ASIAN GUYS serenade him with "Happy Birthday To You." When the guys sitting next to Jimmy lean forward to help blow out the candles on his cake, however, we see that it Vick, ALAN, STU, DOUG, and some BLACK GUY, all very drunk VICK & ALAN & STU & DOUG (ON TAPE) HAPPY BIRTHDAY DEAR JIMMMMY, HAPPY BIRTHDAY TOOO YOOOOU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone applauds. Vick drunkenly hugs Jimmy Lang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Jimmy Lang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merriweather FREEZES FRAME on Vick kissing the top of Jim Lang's shaved head. In the interrogation room, Vick, Stu and Alan sit, frozen Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in a lot of trouble, aren't we.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officers, I swear, we have no memory of that ever occurring--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Maybe a night in jail will jostle something loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, sir, please don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a very important wedding--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know Jimmy Lang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stops, looks at Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy and I tried to raise capital for Girl-nasium, a 24 hour fitness center and day spa for tween-age girls, but it never got off the ground. It was an entirely legitimate enterprise -- I had no idea he was a criminal. We must've bumped into him last night, and he must've invited us to join his birthday celebration. No crime in that, is there, Officers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merriweather gets in Vick's face, intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You actually expect me to believe that dung?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (UNBLINKING) Yes, Officer Merriweather. I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I find out you're lying to me, son, I will take all of you down, is that clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You boys wouldn't last three hours in prison.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu might.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shakes his head, unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now: are you gonna charge us with something, or are we free to go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cops look at each other, scowling. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu and Alan quickly hop to their feet and make for the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thank you, Officers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really nice meeting you--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you know what's good for you, you'll get the hell out of Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Day has turned to night. Vick, Stu, and Alan descend the steps of the police station. The mood is grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have to be such a dick?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got out, didn't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, four hours later! If we'd just cooperated with them--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we'd cooperated with them, we'd be in jail right now, Alan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach the curb, and Stu starts trying to hail a cab. Desperation is setting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna do now? We've got zero leads on where Doug is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why hasn't he called? It's 8:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys shake their heads, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think he's okay--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, don't. Doug is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, we were hanging out with mobsters last night, man! They kill people for looking at `em weird--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu: Doug is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or what if we like drove Doug out to the desert and left him, just as like a funny prank--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu! Enough!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (MUTTERING) I knew I shouldn't have come...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I knew I shouldn't have come this weekend, Vick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (getting heated) Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's right. I only came because Doug insisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick steps towards Alan, heated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do think you're so much better than us, dude?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't -- I just think I'm better than you, Vick! And trust me, it's not that hard! You haven't changed one bit since high school! Jesus, you're 28 years old and you still talk back to cops?! Really?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're out of your depth, Alan--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're still the one getting us in trouble! Only then it was hiding your weed in our locker, and now you've got us partying with wanted felons! It's not cute anymore, man! We're too old for this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick scowls; this is actually hitting home...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all your stupid get-rich-quick schemes?! Girl-nasium?! Custard?! In Los Angeles?! Are you joking?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's all take a breath--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When's the last time you had a real job, man?! When's the last time you had a girlfriend?! Hell, when's the last time you picked up the check?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so great about any of those things?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those "things," Vick, are what grown men do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick swallows, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're all tired and hungry--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of us ever liked you, Alan! We only hung out with you because Doug made us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan recoils, whoa, stung. This is clearly news to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu...? Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu gestures, uncomfortable, enh, who's to say? Alan nods see, his face reddening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would anyone like you, dude? Have you ever thought about that? You're uptight, you're judgemental, you're cheap, and yet somehow you think you're sweeter than everyone else! Well look around, man: no one wants to be you! I'd rather be Stu than you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late: Alan charges Vick and TACKLES him onto the lawn They roll on the ground, trying to punch each other, but ends up being a mess of half-chops, pulled hair, and hand each other's faces...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've...always...hated you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You punch like...your sister...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu runs over and jumps in, trying to break them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, no! Time out! We all need a time out--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK! Stu is accidentally kicked in the face and goes do Alan and Vick continue rolling on the lawn, trying to bea the crap out of each other. They could be kids again. The just when it starts getting way too intense,

dialogues.speaker: A CAR HORN SOUNDS
dialogues.text: And all three of them look up to see Vick'S BEAT-UP CADIL parked on the curb, Chastity at the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That might not be like, the smartest place to fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and Alan look over at the huge LAS VEGAS POLICE DEPARTMENT sign right next to them. They frown...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick's car sits parked in front of a country bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys sit at a booth, their hair a mess, their faces bruised, their clothing ripped, ravenously chowing down o TACOS. Stu's mouth is full of food:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good call on happy hour, Chastity. These tacos kick ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I always come here when I get out of jail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exchange a quick look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey -- how'd you start Vick's car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, my daddy taught me how to hotwire almost anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's funny, because Alan's daddy taught him tax law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity smiles, a little confused. Alan is quick to reto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Vick's daddy taught him how to get really drunk at his kid's soccer games and then piss himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disease, dude--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys, come on! For Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Vick angrily continue eating their tacos. Then S PHONE rings. He pulls it out, reads the caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Number blocked." VINCE                             ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't answer it.                 Answer it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it's Tracy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (torn, answers phone) Good evening, this is Stu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tracy. She's sitting in her living room, on the phon Her STERN FATHER sits nearby, as do other FAMILY MEMBERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu, it's Tracy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His eyes bulging, Stu covers the phone and hisses:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Tracy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick glares at Alan. Alan looks away, shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she calling me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because she knows you're the most easily tricked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have tell her we lost Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No we don't! Tell her nothing, Stu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu turns back to the phone, rattled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Trace! W-What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, nothing, just here with my family... STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that sounds amazing! TRACY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...? Hey, you wouldn't happen to know where Doug is, would you? He said he'd be home by 5 for this dinner, and now it's almost 9:00. I tried his cell, but he didn't answer... STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ummmm........Hang on. (covering the mouthpiece) She wants to know where Doug is! VICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working on it! Buy us some time! ALAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, just tell her the truth! Honesty is always the best policy! VICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you, retarded?! Honesty is never the best policy! Especially not with brides! STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lamely, to phone) Um, what'd you say? TRACY (FROWNING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked if you knew where Doug was. STU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, um, hang on. (to guys) She still wants to know! VICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay: tell her Alan got really drunk last night and fell down, and the doctor said not to move him for a few hours, but that we'll be back in time for the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I have to be the one that fell over drunk?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fictitious canard, Alan, get over yourself! Stu: tell her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Tracy, Alan fell on a DOCTOR--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fell over drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-He was drunk. And the doctor -- a different doctor, not the one he fell on -- he said we couldn't move him until the wedding--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a few hours! We'll be home before the wedding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're going to have the wedding at your home--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy just looks really confused. Exasperated, Vick rips the phone away from Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy?! Vick! How are ya, hon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (now very concerned) Vick, what is going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing! Stu is a moron. Listen, Alan hurt his back last night, so we're gonna be laid up here for a bit, but I promise we'll have Doug home in time for the wedding, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, is Alan all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, luckily he had a steel rod surgically implanted up his ass at birth, so the doctors anticipate a complete and swift recovery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan flips him the bird.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I talk to Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? No! No, you can't actually, Doug...Doug is out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he? He's aaaat...the pharmacy. Yeah, picking up Alan's medications. Listen, Trace, I'm losing you, but we'll see you tomorrow, okay? Bye, sweetie--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick hangs up and nods confidently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She bought it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in her bungalow, Tracy hangs up the phone, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've done something stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her stern father is standing there, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No surprise there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAD--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying, what kind of man stands up his fiance the night before their wedding?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I don't want to hear it. I trust Doug absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Turner backs off. Tracy, however, looks a bit rattled

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys get up from the booth and head for the door, gri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perfect. We just told Tracy we'd have Doug home in 13 hours, and we still have no idea where he is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pass a DOORMAN on their way out, who's standing with stamp and a UV light reader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Handstamp for re-entry? Handstamp for re-entry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone waves, no thanks -- except for Stu, who shrugs, not, and stops, holding out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go back to the hotel and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God, guys! Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu holds his hand under the UV light -- it's covered in STAMPS from all the clubs they've been to the night befor Stu yanks up his sleeve to reveal his ENTIRE FOREARM GLOW completely covered with stamps! The guys hurry back and slide their forearms under the UV light, too: they all have the same stamps! Their eyes ali

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a map of last night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other, hope returning to their face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys rocket down the Strip, weaving in and out of traffic! All the stamps on Stu's arm are now labelled in regular ink. MUSIC blares, and the mood is high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do you want to start?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top! We hit every club we went to til someone remembers what we did with Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice clue, Stuey! I can't believe we're actually gonna pull this off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu grins over at the car next to them. Then he stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey: is that guy wearing Doug's hat?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look over to see that the DRIVER of the next car over is, in fact, wearing the DISTINCTIVE FEDORA-STYLE HA Doug was wearing last night. The guy turns off the Strip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naaah, couldn't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of people have hats like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu nods, yeah, I guess...

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON
dialogues.text: The first bar written on it is "GhostBar."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys blow in, each with a photo of Doug medieval armor) from Alan's wedding. As they move into th club, every single waiter, bartender, and busboy sees the and throws open their arms, heyyyy, remembering them! They flash the picture of Doug to anyone who'll look -- waiters, maitre d's, thugs, bachelorettes, fetishists, bikers, swingers, brides and grooms -- but all of them sh their heads, we have no idea where Doug is...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu crosses off "GhostBar" from his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys and Chastity enter and disperse. Again, everyone recognizes them and hugs them like returning heroes -- an again, no one remembers where they were taking Doug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu crosses off another stamp from his arm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER recognizes the guys from the night before and unclips the rope, letting them in past the immense line..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER recognizes the guys from the night before and unclips the rope, letting them in past the immense line..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BOUNCER recognizes the guys from the night before and unclips the rope, letting them in past the immense line..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys race through a shadier, more industrial area of town, their hopes dimming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right, this is the last place we went, "Chaps."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick rolls to a stop in front of...

dialogues.speaker: CHAPS NIGHTCLUB
dialogues.text: It takes a moment for the guys to realize that everyone i line is male, buff, and wearing erotic cowboy gear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure we came here...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they look up at the marquee. It reads "CHAPS: HOME O

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Golden Pony. That's us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I'll just wait in the car--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Vick is already shoving Stu out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys walk into the massive nightclub and stop. It's g kitschy barn theme, and hosts 200 TOPLESS DUDES in cowboy hats and short-shorts grinding on each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think we would've remembered this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't think we came here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why is your underwear nailed to the wall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys turn to see numerous pairs of MEN'S UNDERWEAR na to the wall nearby. A sign above it reads "CHAPS WALL OF FAME." We recognize Stu's COLORADO STATE BOXERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those could be anybody's. Thousands of people go to Colorado State--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking more closely) Oh my God, are they autographed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (READING) "Stu Pryce, 9/30/08. I     Chaps!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing, stunned) I am so gay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a BUFF WAITER in assless chaps blows by, smili

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, guys! Roger is backstage!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other, eyes wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: R-Roger?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys move through the throng of undulating, sweaty me uncomfortable. Alan takes Chastity's hand tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay very close to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles and dances through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They reach a HUGE MALE BOUNCER guarding the backstage are He sees the guys and unclips the VELVET ROPE, kissing eac them on the cheek as they pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are Haylee and Kaitlin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally disturbed) Oh. G-Good, thanks...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys reach the dressing room door and stop. They inha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to love you either way, Stu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu nods, focussed, nervous, like before a big game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of my best friends are gay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not...not really? I live in Connecticut, man, we don't even have black people yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu nods, right. Then, after steeling himself, he enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dressing room is packed with muscular, tan, buck-nake men, walking around, rubbing baby oil on themselves, donn chaps and codpieces, getting ready for the next show.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys move through the mob of beefcake, staying ridiculously close together. Vick stops at one dancer, trying not to look down at his junk:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, friend, can you tell me where Roger is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Vick! Roger's over there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He points to a really hot, really naked guy with a funky mullet, stretching out in front of his mirror. The guys shuffle over to him. Vick tries to be supportive with Stu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's cute...I guess...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shrugs, yeah, I guess...? As they draw close, Roger s them, and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh! Hey guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hugs all of them. The guys make sure to keep their ass arched back to avoid genital contact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm surprised you're even walking yet, Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (inhaling sharply) Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, man, we don't really remember what happened last night, can you fill us in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? No memory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shakes his head, wide-eyed, scared...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I must say, Stu, I'm a little hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we...you know...do anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, duh? Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all freeze. A beat. Then Vick pats Stu's shoulde supportive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was I...the boy or the girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, honey, you were everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu WHIMPERS. Vick and Alan exchange a look, holy shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were nothing like Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait-- what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, I'm sort of over group stuff too, but Alan insisted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's Alan's turn to look stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You insisted?! Why'd you insist?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! I don't know why I insisted!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, after the anger went away, it was really quite tender.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other, nauseous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really not sure we can be friends anymore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, Chastity starts LAUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys: he's kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger breaks into a smile and slaps five with Chastity. T guys all exhale, incredibly relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not cool, Roger. Not cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what did happen last night?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, well, you guys came in near the end of our last set, like 2ish. Doug pretty much dragged you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? Doug did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, my Doug, not your Doug. Black guy, shaved head?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a cake designer, he said he met you guys at some sort of birthday party at the Rio?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snapping his finger) The guy from the Jimmy Lang surveillance video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys nod, right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway, for the big finale of our show, we always bring someone on stage, and, well, Stu, you volunteered pretty aggressively. (to nearby dancer) Hey Dallas, do we have the video of last night's show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! That's cool, I don't need to see it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must see that video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's in the machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger nods and presses PLAY on a little VCR/TV combo sitt in front of his mirror. ON THE TV a very Brokeback, Chippendale's-style male revue starts playing. Stu GASPS. Roger fast forwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were pretty mellow at first, Stu, but once we got you into the chaps, you really came alive-- oh, here it is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV we see Stu, wearing only his "I    ROGER" g-str and assless chaps, grinding on stage with the Golden Pony dancers. He is way fatter, paler, and hairier than the greased young studs. The guys look away, oooo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a Dad, I-I don't get to the gym as much as I'd like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You even taught us The Pony, which we'd never even heard of before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE TV Stu gets on all fours on the stage, and eagerly gestures for the dancers to take turns "riding" him. Stu's face drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then, of course, the pice de resistance: the Ride of the Valkyries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE VIDEO Stu clutches onto Roger from behind as they a LAVENDER MECHANICAL BULL together. The crowd goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Annnnd that would explain the searing ass pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the show, we split a couple pitchers of flirtinis, you had our stylist cut your hair like mine, and then you split.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what time was all this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4:30 in the morning? 4:45?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our Doug was with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he had passed out by then, but you carried him out. It was all very Officer And A Gentleman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys look at each other, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, so we left with Doug at 4:45, we got back to the hotel at 5:00, and Doug was gone by 5:30 when Chastity met back up with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did we lose him along the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was passed out, how far could he have gone--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Vick's cellphone rings. The caller ID reads "MANDALAY BAY." He answers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir is on the phone at the reception desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Lennon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir, many greetings to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you might like to know that one of our maids just found your friend, Douglas, passed out in your room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick's jaw drops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Are you sure it's him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw him with my own eyes. He is unconscious but breathing nicely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank you, Atashir! You are a man of great honor! A thousand blessings upon your ancestors!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick SLAMS his phone shut, overjoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug is in the room! A maid just found him! He's passed out, but he's okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're sure it's him?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atashir swears it is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all laugh, a massive weight lifted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh thank God he's okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After all this?! He's in the room?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They keep laughing and hug each other, heartfelt. Vick ev hugs Roger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't even care! Hug me, you big shiny homosexual!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys bound out of Chaps, jubilant. Stu i carrying a box of TWO DOZEN VIDEOTAPES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was cool of Roger to give you all the tapes of your performance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, if I actually was gay, I'd totally date Roger first. What a gentle soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get into Vick's clunker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we doing on time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at watch) 2:22.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll be in LA by dawn. (firing up engine) I told you bitches this would all work out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive off into the night, grins all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick drives, Stu sits shotgun. Alan sits in the back with Chastity. The cool night air washes over them. They look happily exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has officially been the craziest weekend of my life. (to Chastity) Thanks for all your help. You were awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything for my hubby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan's smile flickers slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kidding, Alan. I know last night wasn't, you know, real...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks out at Vegas as it flies by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about all this, Chastity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beg pardon?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Jennifer. Jennifer Elly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan hesitates; suddenly she seems a lot more...human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, I'm sorry, Jennifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't be. Last night wasn't the first flaky decision I've ever made in my life. I mean, I am a stripper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan tries not to laugh. She smiles, a twinge sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LA. Tarzana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I work here on the weekends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fly out every week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I'd move, but my kid is in a great school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (aside, to Stu) They always have kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a little girl, Sarah. She's... Well, she's everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity proudly shows Alan a photo from her purse of a c little toddler. Alan smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No kids. Same girlfriend for 14 years. Becky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan shows her a photo of Becky on his cellphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, she's stunning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu turns around, unable to keep quiet any longer:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We like you way better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STU!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity tries to stymie her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky is great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky collects teapots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's a total canwego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, she's the girl at the party who's always like "Can we go? Can we go?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity laughs. Alan does too, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has low blood sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She has low fun sugar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, guys! This is the girl I'm going to marry! (beat, considers) If, you know...she forgives me for cheating on her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait: you're going to tell her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm going to tell her! I could never keep something like that from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, she still hasn't forgiven me for scratching her Queensryche CD in sixth grade -- she's neeeeever gonna forgive you for marrying a stripper in Vegas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, then that's just the price I'm going to have to pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks off, stoic. Chastity pats his hand, proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles at Alan, impressed, pulling her hair from her face. Alan looks at her anew... It's a sweet moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's gonna cut your dick off, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lamborghini's, Ferrari's and Hummer limos clog the valet stand. Vick rolls up in his clunker. The guys hop out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the valet) Keep `er close, Paco. We'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity and the guys hurry down the hallway to their sui Vick unlocks their door and pushes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug! Wake up, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of finding Doug, however, they find KALOLO FANALU sitting on their couch, pissed. He's got a huge WHITE CAS his right arm, courtesy of the strip club bouncers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aloha, assholes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys freeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door SLAMS behind them, and they whip around to see KIKIOLANI standing in front of the door, blocking their e He has an identical CAST on his right arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, a toilet FLUSHES and an immensely large man in red suit exits the bathroom, drying his hands. We recogni him from his police photo as crime boss JIMMY LANG, 50's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hello. Good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mr. Lang, whatever we did last night, we are incredibly sorry-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These your rich friends you were telling me about, Vick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Stu glance at Vick, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you haven't told them yet? Really, that's low. Even for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on, Vick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick stammers, trying to find the words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six months ago, your friend Vick borrowed some money from me at what can only be described as a very unfavorable interest rate. When the loan came due, he failed to pay me back, but he promised me that he could get the money from you guys this weekend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Stu look at Vick, shocked and hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Vick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you do this to us, man? We're your best friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick looks away, ashamed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were gonna hurt me, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Vick, it looks like you and your friends have some issues to discuss. In the meantime...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He draws a huge, red-plated .357 MAGNUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need my goddamn money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys jump back, whoa! Vick holds up his hands:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get it! I can! I just--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've heard that before, Vick, including last night, when you so rudely skipped out on my birthday party. That's why I've taken some collateral to ensure your payment. His name is Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all look sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want your friend to live, meet me at mile marker 26 off Highway 12 at dawn, and bring the money. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy nods and heads for the door. The Samoans follow him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: M-M-Mr. Lang?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Mr. Mervish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: H-How much does Vick owe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 thousand dollars?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Stu pace about the suite, beyond stressed. Vick stands, looking out the window. Chastity gets them all wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell could you blow that kind of money?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it for the custard store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, Stu, wake up! There is no custard store! Vick was just trying to rip us off to pay back Jimmy Lang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that true, Vick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick just stares out at the city, not denying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were any of your deals...real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (GUILTY) Some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu drops onto the couch, deeply disillusioned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, I manage an Applebee's, that money meant something to me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick spins around, furious:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you really think I wanted my life to turn out like this, Stu?! Do you really think I don't know that I'm a massive loser?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, you guys got out of high school and you just knew what to do, you went to college and got good jobs and found cool wives and made beautiful children -- what do I have to show for the last decade of my life?! Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick swats a lamp off a nearby end-table -- it SMASHES against the wall! The guys freeze. Tense silence. Vick grows emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, I'm almost 30, and the only thing I really have...the only thing I really have is you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Vick--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man, it's true! I put on a good show, but my life is so goddamn hollow and vapid and lonely, it scares me, man. I-I don't know how much longer I can keep this scam going. And now I've gone and ruined the one good thing I had...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears threaten in his eyes. He wipes at them, angry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just...please don't give up on me, okay? I-I don't know what I'd do without you guys. I really don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan and Stu exchange a look. They've never seen brash, c Vick this vulnerable before. Stu can't help but give in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, man, we've been bro's since third grade, it's gonna take a lot more than money to ruin our friendship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick looks down, deeply touched...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I don't understand is why you didn't just ask me for the money. I would've given you every last cent I had, man...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tears trail down Vick's cheeks. He crosses and gives Stu hug. Stu hugs back, emotional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love you too, bro. Love you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They hug tight. For a while.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, I banged your sister sophomore year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Just seemed like a good time to tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick stammers at Stu, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She had just broken up with that guy from Central, we were playing "I Never" at Tim Donahee's pool, one thing lead to another--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! No. That's...that's plenty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick desperately tries to clear the image from his mind. just frowns at his watch, stressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm glad we're all sharing, but we've got three hours to come up with 200 grand, or else...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys nod, frowning, back on point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd offer to take a loan out, but it's 3 o'clock in the morning, I'm pretty sure my bank is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I can get a 20 grand cash advance on my credit card...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that just leaves 180 grand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys frown at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it is Vegas...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys' eyebrows all rise, you think...?

dialogues.speaker: ALAN THROWING DOWN BLACKJACK AT A BLACKJACK TABLE
dialogues.text: The guys erupt in CHEERS around him, YAAA! The dealer sli over a large pile of CHIPS.

dialogues.speaker: CHASTITY THROWING CRAPS AT A CRAPS TABLE
dialogues.text: Again the guys erupt! Alan hugs Chastity. Their pile of C grows...

dialogues.speaker: STU YELLING "BINGO" AT A BINGO TABLE
dialogues.text: The guys jump up, slapping ten, YELLING! Stu points at a table full of OLD LADIES nearby: in your face!

dialogues.speaker: ALAN, STU, VICK AND CHASTITY SITTING AT A PAI GOW TABLE
dialogues.text: looking lost. Then they take their large stack of chips a quietly leave. No one knows how to play Pai Gow poker.

dialogues.speaker: VICK JUMPING UP FROM A WAR TABLE
dialogues.text: having just won! Chastity and the guys aggressively hug h Stu drinks from his glass, hands shaking, wired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time check!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at watch) 12 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chip check!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan quickly counts the chips...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faster! Come on chip check!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, how many Red Bulls have you had?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I stopped counting at six! I can hear my heart beating in my head!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan finishes counting the chips -- and frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just over 100 grand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys wince, damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing left to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all exchange a knowing look...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: at a roulette table. The guys sweat, tense. Stu is insane

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure we don't want red?! What if the ball lands on red--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Stu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betting is closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Croupier drops the ball into the wheel. It bounces, h spins... Vick crosses himself. Stu looks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch! My   heart's gonna explode! Can your   heart even explode?! Because   I think my heart is gonna explode!   I can't watch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball lands. Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's red, isn't it?! I knew it! Tell me it's not red!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not red...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu turns, ecstatic--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ball has stopped on green, DOUBLE ZERO. Stu clutches chest, like he's having a seizure. Vick inhales, grim. Al slowly drops to his knees. Chastity closes her eyes. Their HUGE PILE OF CHIPS is raked off the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys pack their bags into Vick's beat-up Caddy. The m is as dark as the pre-dawn sky. When the car is loaded, Chastity takes Alan's hands, gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like me to come with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...It might get a little dangerous. I wouldn't want...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trails off. Chastity nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry...about everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for all your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awkward silence. The cold desert wind blows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no sense...in exchanging numbers or anything...right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, probably not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks genuinely sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...I'll always remember you as a great first husband, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both smile weakly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can just send the divorce papers to the Crazy Horse or whatever...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan nods, okay. Another awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for reminding me that there are still some really good guys out there, Alan. I don't...I don't get to meet too many of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles a bit sadly, kisses him on the cheek, and walk off. TIGHT ON Alan's Grandmother's ring still on her fing Alan doesn't remember the ring, however; he's too busy watching her walk out of his life, and feeling a real sen of loss... Then Vick fires up the car next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta go, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan nods, yeah, and gets in the car...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick's car races down a dark, abandoned desert highway. T guys look tired, stressed, and most of all, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep, just driving out to the middle of desert to meet some mobsters, what could possibly go wrong...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all frown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's our plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should tell Mr. Lang that we couldn't get the money, but that, if he's amenable, we could create a payment calendar--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna give Jimmy a dummy bag of money, grab Doug, and make a run for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, good! What an airtight plan--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Lang doesn't do payment calendars, Alan! Trust me: this is our only shot of getting Doug back! Left turn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick skids onto Highway 12 -- a barely labelled dirt road Things are quickly going from bad to worse...

dialogues.speaker: THE FIRST RAYS OF DAWN
dialogues.text: streaking across Venice Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy exits her bedroom in her jammies, looking like she barely slept. Her father is up, and making breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope. (BEAT) I know you don't want to hear it, Trace, but you deserve better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy frowns, overwhelmed with stress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure everything's fine. They're all smart, capable adults...

dialogues.speaker: VICK DELICATELY LAYING CASH INSIDE HIS DUFFEL BAG
dialogues.text: on top of his dirty clothing, fruitlessly trying to creat the appearance of a bag full of money. He's using some $2 bills, but also some $5's and $1's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This all the cash we got?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys frown at their empty wallets, yeah. We are

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Caddy is parked next to MILE MARKER 26 in the middle the windy desert. The Las Vegas skyline is just barely visible in the distance. Vick very delicately zips up his duffel bag so as not to disturb the bills, and places it on his lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the dumbest plan ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan I need you positive please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here they come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look up to see a WHITE YUKON approaching on the horizon, kicking up a trail of dust. The guys tense up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stuart?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's an emergency bottle of tequila in my glove box. Get it out please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu opens the glovebox, pulls out a bottle of Patron. He opens it, takes a swig, then passes it to Vick, who takes pull and passes it to Alan, who also drinks. They all watch the white Yukon draw ever closer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is how we're going to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yukon pulls up about ten yards away. No one moves. The Yukon's doors open... The Cadillac's doors open... TIGHT ON the Jimmy Lang's RED BOOT as it hits the road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON Vick's LEATHER SHOE, then Alan's SAILING TOPSIDE then Stu's FLIP-FLOP, as they all hit the dusty road... The two parties stand by their respective cars, facing of Somewhere in the desert, a rattlesnake RATTLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see the money!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick gently holds up his duffel bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Lang nods to Kalolo, who opens the back door of the Yukon and pulls out a GUY with his hands tied behind his and a plastic RALPH'S BAG over his head; he struggles a b The guys look a bit alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, what'd they do to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull off the Ralph's bag!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy yanks the bag off of the guy's head to reveal

dialogues.speaker: IT'S NOT DOUG
dialogues.text: It's some black dude. Vick, Stu, and Alan look confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANNOYED) This is Doug!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pushes the guy forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God: it's the other Doug! Roger's friend, the cake designer!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Jimmy Lang) I told you, man, I'm Doug Howland! I barely even know these guys!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you got the wrong Doug, man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy Lang and the thugs look exasperated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, man, our Doug is white!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were partying with this guy at my birthday thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you, bro, this isn't the Doug we requested!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. I apologize for the mix-up... (drawing his HUGE GUN) But I'm still gonna need my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick and the guys start backtracking towards their car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God Oh my God Oh my God...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move, Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick freezes, duffel in hand, as Stu and Alan slink from view. Jimmy reaches Vick, gun calmly trained at his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now please. Give me my money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All eyes on Vick, anxiously clutching the bag in his hand Sweat beads on his brow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be stupid, son. You--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Vick throws a hard left hook, SLAMMING Jimmy square his massive stomach! And

dialogues.speaker: NOTHING HAPPENS
dialogues.text: Jimmy is built like a tank. Vick freezes, oh shit. Then J PISTOL-WHIPS Vick -- his lip explodes with blood and he f to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ that hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Jimmy picks up the duffel bag. Hefts it. Feels wrong goes to open the zipper when he hears:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAAAHHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy looks up to see Stu insanely charging him like the linebacker he once was! Jimmy raises his gun, but

dialogues.speaker: STU TACKLES JIMMY TO THE GROUND FIRST
dialogues.text: The gun flies free and they wrestle for it! Dust flies!

dialogues.speaker: BACK BY THE YUKON
dialogues.text: The two Guamians fumble for their guns -- but it's diffic with huge CASTS on their shooting hands!

dialogues.speaker: ON BLACK DOUG
dialogues.text: He sees what's going down, and, his hands tied behind his back, takes off sprinting towards Vegas!

dialogues.speaker: BY THE CADDILAC
dialogues.text: Alan looks around, what should I do?! What should I do?! he spots the keys in the ignition of the car. He hops in fires up the engine! Just then

dialogues.speaker: THE TWO GUAMIANS OPEN FIRE
dialogues.text: Bullets pound into the Cadillac! Alan ducks down, terrifi and floors the gas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being shot at! I'm being shot at!

dialogues.speaker: UP AHEAD
dialogues.text: Jimmy Lang throws Stu off of him and recovers his gun, panting. He cocks it, aims it at Stu on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really didn't want to kill anyone TODAY--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then WHAM! Alan drives the car into Jimmy Lang at 25mph! The obese mobster is pitched off his feet, and lands a go ten yards away, in a heap of dust! The guys freeze, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Guamians freeze, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, is he okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares! Go go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan floors the car while Stu and Vick SPRINT and DIVE in The caddy peels the hell out of there, kicking up rocks a dust! The Guamians FIRE after them!

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS IMPACT ALL ALL OVER CAR
dialogues.text: taking out the tail-lights, the windshield, the headrests The guys duck down til they're sufficiently far away. The they sit up, amazed, out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just saved my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you just drove my car into Jimmy Lang!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan drives, his eyes as big as saucers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna be really upset!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I was just thinking that!

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON JIMMY LANG
dialogues.text: The huge mobster lies face-down on the desert floor. His henchmen waddle up, highly concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, Boss, you okay?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy sputters into the dirt, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find Vick... And kill him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys race down the dusty highway in traumatized silen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now can we call Tracy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick frowns and blots his split lip with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. It's probably time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys pull up at a lone, dusty payphone in the middle the desert. They all look at the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who wants to make the call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Then Vick reaches for his nose, odd man out. Stu an Alan immediately reach for their noses, too. It's close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! No! I beat you by a mile!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick, who won?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (FROWNING) Actually...I should do it. This weekend was mostly my fault. I need to Man Up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks shocked -- and impressed -- by Vick's newfound sense of responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'll be damned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick grabs the bottle of Patron, takes a long swig. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I still can't believe Stu banged my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick hands the bottle to Alan, gets out, and makes for th pay phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy is putting on her makeup in the bridal suite. Her s dad blows in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word from Doug?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The way he spits out "Doug" tells us all we need to know about how Mr. Turner feels about his future son-in-law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm sure he's--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, Tracy's CELL PHONE rings. She quickly answers

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: VICK
dialogues.text: In the desert, on the pay phone, looking through his bust aviators into the rising sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, it's Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Vick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, honey...The bachelor party got a little out of control and, well...we lost Doug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (her jaw dropping) What?! But we're getting married in like four hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's not gonna happen...

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN THE CAR
dialogues.text: Alan starts to take a pull of Patron -- when he freezes, realizing something!

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO VICK
dialogues.text: on the phone with Tracy, being genuinely contrite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm really sorry, Trace. This is all my fault--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Alan flies out of nowhere and snatches the rece out of Vick's hand!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the--?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan gets on the phone with Tracy, his heart racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy, it's Alan! Hey, Vick is just joking around! We've got Doug right here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick looks like: what?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (HORRIFIED) What kind of joke is that?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Vick is such a prick! We'll see you at the wedding! Bye!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan hangs up and races back to the car. Vick follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know where Doug is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy stands in her bridal suite. Then she just BREAKS DO SOBBING. Her father hurries over, concerned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan floors the car back onto the 15 towards Vegas, amped

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when we saw Doug's bed impaled on the griffin thing?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, we threw it out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No: the windows don't open, remember?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how did--? (REALIZING) Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's why we've been seeing Doug's clothes all over Vegas! He was trying to signal someone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't believe it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I still don't get it--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it totally jives with the timeline, right?! We brought Doug back to the hotel at 5:00, he was passed out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's so obvious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not...to me...so much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you figure it out?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Patron, man! It reminded me of our first drink of the night!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, dude, you're a genius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAN SOMEONE PLEASE TELL ME WHERE DOUG IS?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's on the roof!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu looks confused, the roof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After Doug passed out, we must've taken him up there in his bed as a prank, so he'd wake up on the roof or whatever? Then we forgot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And all day he's been throwing his crap off the roof, trying to signal someone to get him down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he's still up there?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only one way to find out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys peel up to the valet and sprint out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys race through the lobby at top speed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys burst out of the steel door, onto the massive bl tar roof. It's empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG?! DOUG?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHERE ARE YOU, MAN?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Doug is nowhere to be seen. The guys start to despair Then...stepping out from behind an air-conditioning vent, naked except for tighty-whities, his entire body bright p from sunburn...

dialogues.speaker: IS DOUG
dialogues.text: And he looks furious. The guys run to him, overjoyed!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, I'm so glad you're okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before they can hug him, though, Doug holds up his hand, whispers, nasty, parched:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't...even...talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys stop short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, no, that's cool!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you have every right to be upset! We validate your anger!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys gingerly rush Doug, now in a Mandalay Bay bathro and clutching an arm-full of BOTTLED WATERS, through the hotel lobby. Alan is arguing into his cellphone. As they pass ATASHIR at his desk, Vick yells over:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why'd you do it, sweet Atashir?! Why did you betray us?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because they paid me. And also because you're kind of racist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fair enough! See you next time, you beautiful Judas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They blow out of the hotel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where their beatup Caddy is waiting. Alan slams his cellphone shut, frowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No flights to LA with empty seats!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can't drive! It's 350 miles to LA and the wedding starts at 10, which is in--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at watch) --three hours!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Then Vick, Stu and Alan exchange a look...a smile slowly creeps across their faces.

dialogues.speaker: THE TOTALLED CADILLAC ROCKETING DOWN I-15
dialogues.text: Vick is at the wheel, leaning on the HORN, keeping the th doored Caddy at 110 miles per hour. When traffic gets thi he doesn't hesitate to drive in the shoulder. In the backseat, Doug chugs bottled water, still simmerin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Doug, I think I speak for everyone in the car when I say I'm really sorry about locking you on the roof of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta admit, it's a pretty funny prank... I mean, up until the part when we forgot all about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug just stares out at the desert in stony silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's still not talking to us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally understandable, man. Whenever you're ready...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers bustle about the grand lawn of the Bel Air Bay Cl putting the last touches on the outdoor wedding site. It's beautiful: the royal palms, the expansive views of t Pacific, the white chairs in perfect rows, the altar ador in roses. A HARPIST begins to warm up as well-heeled GUES filter in, finding their seats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy checks her watch as a HAIRSTYLIST works on her hair Then she checks her watch again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GARY'S TUXEDO VAN speeds up alongside the Caddy as they down the 10 freeway. A very nervous TEENAGER opens the va sliding door and, wind whipping his face, throws a huge PACKAGE over to Alan, who stands and catches it! Vick nod the van driver and shouts over the wind:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I OWE YOU, NEECO!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver gives Vick a thumbs up, and heads off. Alan ri open the package -- inside are four TUXEDOS. The guys sta taking off their tattered clothes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the seats at the wedding are filled. Everyone is ther Except the Groomsmen. Or the Groom. The harpist still pla though she's starting to look a little pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking beautiful in her wedding gown, Tracy gazes out of window at the perfect wedding arranged below... Then she notices guests whispering, is something wrong? Where's the groom? She turns away, trying to hold it together...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys,   now in their tuxes, rocket down the freeway, primping.   Alan brushes his teeth, Doug tries to comb hi hair, Stu   flosses, and Vick shaves with an electric raz he weaves   in and out of traffic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy paces in the bridal suite. Then Mr. Turner enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, honey, but I think you need to seriously consider that Doug might not be coming...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy stops short, speechless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some men just aren't cut out for this kind of commitment. I'm so sorry that this is how you had to find out--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then, we hear a car SQUEALING UP outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bridesmaids sit around the posh lobby, waiting, anxio Just then, the doors blow open and

dialogues.speaker: VICK, ALAN, STU, AND DOUG
dialogues.text: stride inside! Their tuxes are wrinkled, their hair is a mess, and the groom is bright pink -- but they're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Mapquest took us a crazy route. We ready to do this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bridesmaids sit up, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY AND HER FATHER
dialogues.text: walking down the aisle, arm-in-arm, as Mozart plays. Trac looks tentative. Her father frowns, not at all happy...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE AUDIENCE
dialogues.text: Everyone smiles, AHHS, and snaps photos...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE ALTAR
dialogues.text: The groomsmen smile as well. Vick whispers to Doug:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks beautiful, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug still doesn't speak to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cool. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: TRACY
dialogues.text: reaches the altar, then turns to her dad. His face is a m of emotions. They hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, pumpkin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy's Dad shoots Doug a nasty look before taking his se in the first row. Then Tracy approaches Doug at the altar, and whispers to angry, hurt:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where were you? And why are you pink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
