dialogues.text: It's a long story. All I can say is I'm so sorry. And I promise, for as long as we're married, I will never ever put you through something like this again. (desperate, pleading) Can... Can you forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy studies his face, searching... All the guests wait with bated breath... The groomsmen wince, come on come on come on... Then, unable to be mad at Doug, Tracy smiles and kisses h He kisses her back. The guests all SIGH in relief. The groomsmen exhale, whew. Vick and Alan covertly knock fist The Minister clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We, um, we traditionally wait til the end for the kiss...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Doug and Tracy just keep on kissing...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG AND TRACY STILL KISSING
dialogues.text: at the reception. The entire wedding party is applauding.

dialogues.speaker: CHAMPAGNE IS UNCORKED
dialogues.text: and the WEDDING BAND kicks in. We are now down on the law where white tables and a dance floor have been set up.

dialogues.speaker: STANDING IN THE BACK OF THE RECEPTION
dialogues.text: Vick, Stu, and Alan aggressively APPLAUD and WHISTLE for bride and the groom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We did it, fellahs. We pulled it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had a doubt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH. Alan smiles, more relaxed than we've ever see him. They sip champagne and watch Doug and Tracy enjoy th first dance on the dance floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Doug's ever going to talk to us again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Like a decade or two--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then Stu sees someone approaching over Alan's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all look over to see

dialogues.speaker: BECKY
dialogues.text: Alan's girlfriend of 14 years, bearing down on them, irat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Beck--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Vick! Alan, where the hell have you been?! I've been calling and calling! What, you don't answer your phone anymore?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan shrinks down, back to being the chastised boyfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I'm so sorry, I can explain--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's a WOMAN'S VOICE behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn to see

dialogues.speaker: CHASTITY
dialogues.text: standing behind them in a very sexy, very elegant dress, hair back. She cleans up nicely. Alan swallows, whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This just got complicated...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jennifer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity smiles that he called her by her real name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I-I know I wasn't invited, but I just had to return this...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Alan his GRANDMOTHER'S HOLOCAUST RING. Becky watches on, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay: who the hell is this chick, and why the hell does she have your Grandmother's wedding ring?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks back and forth between Becky and Chastity... It's the moment of truth. The fork in life's road...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk, you moron! Jesus, you're just like your mother! Talk! Who's the ho wearing my ring?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in that moment, it all becomes so clear. Alan turns:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky's jaw drops. Chastity smiles slightly. Stu and Vick grin, oh shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't make each other happy anymore, Beck. And we can keep not making each other happy for another 14 years -- hell, maybe even another 50 years -- but let's not. Let's find people who make our hearts race. Let's be excited and fun and alive again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan looks at Becky, sincere, honest. Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan shakes his head, sadly, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Beck. I really am. (to Chastity) Can I buy you a free drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chastity smiles, takes his arm, and they walk off togethe towards the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not...actually...still married, are we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's start with dinner, and see where it goes...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling warmly) I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON BECKY
dialogues.text: She finally recovers enough to speak:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alan! Alan Steven Mervish, get back here this second! (but Alan keeps walking) Don't you walk away from me, you stupid little clown! I own you! GET BACK HERE IMMEDIATELY!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Alan just keeps walking away with Chastity. Vick and wave him on, go dude! Go! Then Becky turns on them. Beat. They both scatter, terrif

dialogues.speaker: STAY WITH STU
dialogues.text: as he hurries off through the crowd. After a moment, he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu turns to see his TWO ANGELIC DAUGHTERS in sundresses racing through the crowd towards him! They leap into his arms, so excited to see him! He scoops them both up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I missed you guys so much!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We missed you too, daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the best dad ever!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. And then Stu just starts BAWLING. Tears everywhere. His lovely wife ERIN appears, harried, a diaper bag over shoulder, and sees him crying. She rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, are you still drunk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stu shakes his head, no, and keeps SOBBING as he pulls he into a big family hug...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick, a cocktail in hand, his tie undone, heads into the men's room and approaches a urinal. Then KIKIOLANI and KA FANALUA walk in behind him, still in their huge arm casts still very pissed. Vick inhales, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay, I'll go with you. Just...don't ruin the wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then JIMMY LANG enters the bathroom on RED CRUTCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really didn't want it to end like this, Vick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick nods, resigned, and starts towards him. Then Jimmy extends his hand for Vick to shake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (totally thrown) Um, what...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend Alan just paid your marker. Took out a second mortgage on his house. The full 200 grand, plus medical expenses, which I thought was a classy touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vick looks blown away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without our friends, we are nothing, Vick. Remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three injured mobsters exit. Vick remains standing th overwhelmed, his life literally saved...

dialogues.speaker: VICK, STU, AND ALAN
dialogues.text: standing on the cliffs overlooking the Pacific, drinks in hand, as the wedding reception rages on behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will pay you back, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn straight you will!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, so what the hell happened this weekend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys turn to see Doug approaching, smiling. They grin he falls in with them, looking out at the calm blue ocean

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Alan married a stripper, Stu went gay, and I learned a very important life lesson from an obese hoodlum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll tell you the whole story when you get back from your honeymoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We really are sorry, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doug nods, I know. Vick raises his cocktail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Doug and Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Doug and Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Doug and Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To me and Tracy -- and to being here, with my three former best friends in the world...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys LAUGH.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nowhere else I'd rather be right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They nod, heartfelt, hear-hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That said, let's not get too stupid tonight, okay? I'm going on my honeymoon in 24 hours...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys all nod reassuringly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. / We'll be good. / Totally, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys exchange a sly smile, CLINK glasses, then
